alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 7:52AM CDT until October 29 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .Heavy rain across the area early Tuesday into this morning has resulted in flooding along the Black River at Black River Falls. The river is forecasted to reach major flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 50.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 43.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 50.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 57.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 55.9 feet on 08/28/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM CDT.
